article.title: Geostatistical estimation of forest biomass in interior Alaska combining Landsat-derived tree cover, sampled airborne lidar and field observations

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following study sites is located entirely within the Tanana Valley State Forest (TVSF)?
What does the cross-covariance matrix (K) in the Coregionalization model primarily represent?
choices: The spatial correlation between aboveground biomass and lidar-derived 90th percentile height.
The non-spatial variance of both aboveground biomass and lidar-derived 90th percentile height.
The spatial variance and covariance between the spatial random effects for aboveground biomass and lidar-derived 90th percentile height.
The influence of Landsat tree cover data on aboveground biomass and lidar-derived 90th percentile height.

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following models consistently demonstrates the least amount of residual spatial autocorrelation across all four study sites?
What is the main conclusion drawn from the relationship between permafrost proportion and AGB density at the watershed unit level?
choices: Permafrost presence has no discernible relationship with AGB density.
AGB density increases with increasing permafrost proportion.
AGB density decreases with increasing permafrost proportion.
The relationship between permafrost proportion and AGB density is inconclusive.
